result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan T McDermitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for Sentence Modification  to reinstate CRT Order & release def to JSS

to EML  from Chad, JSS   re: Def is choosing to sit his sentence in jail instead of EM.  Jail will not take him unless they receive CRT Order indicating this.  Req Order be sent
PER EML:  Def can set his sentence in jail w/o EM
assigned PO Jenna Rose

3 pm Def in court w/ Atty Timothy J Guth.  Def in custody.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State has complied with victim notification requirements.  Hynek comments.  I will leave the length of prison up to the court.  Confinement is appropriate...  Guth comments.  I think he'll be better served here on probation....  1 year CJ would be appropriate....  McDermitt comments.  Court comments.
SENTENCE withheld on each count  
15CF262 Count 2 - 2 years probation with 1 year incarceration
15CF-473  3 years probation with 1 year incarceration - concurrent with 15CF-262 and with 233 days credit and with the last of the sentence to be served on em
